page.title: 02OUR COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: The countryside around Donington is mainly taken up with farming. When we went out to do our surveys we found that the land is very flat, with no hills at all. The land is divided in to fields. Some have hedges as boundaries but in many cases the hedges have been removed. Most of the fields are surrounded by ditches to help the land to drain. Some of the things we saw growing were potatoes, cabbages, cauliflowers, wheat, barley and bulbs. There are also some very large glass houses covering several acres where cauliflowers and cabbage plants are started off and where tomatoes and cucumbers are grown in the summer.
